message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper is about evaluating the ability of neural machine translation models to handle discourse phenomena, which is a topic related to natural language processing and computational linguistics. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also proposes novel strategies for exploiting context, which involves training and optimizing neural networks, making it relevant to sub-categories such as cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper uses subtitles as training data, which involves processing visual information, making cs.CV (Computer Vision) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper involves evaluating the performance of models using metrics, which is related to optimization and evaluation techniques in neural networks, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) a possible sub-category as well.
